Everyone shared their craziest quarantine stories; here are a few of them:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What's your craziest quarantine story? </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/21/europe-battles-higher-caseloads-economic-warning-signs?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Europe’s Recovering on the Wrong Side of the Road
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Men wearing stirped shirts taking tourists on a Euopean boat tour" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTg2L2V1cm9wZWFuX2JvYXRfdG91ci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>ANDREA PATTARO/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sometimes, all it takes is one number to tell a much larger story. That number: 51.6.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, IHS Markit's purchasing managers’ index for the 19-country eurozone <a href="https://apnews.com/8f31e8d12dcd08fd1a43ca140ef3a482?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped</a> to 51.6 in August from 54.9 in July. It’s a closely watched indicator of business activity and its slippage reveals that, after a hot start, Europe’s economic recovery has hit the breaks.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Summertime sadness</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In these pandemic times, economic slippage often correlates with rising caseloads. And this week, European heavyweights Germany, Italy, and France all reported their highest new coronavirus case numbers since the spring. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Spain, in particular, is experiencing a </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/4e3e3e31-87ed-4631-af62-c649efb854ed?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worse outbreak</a></span><span> than its peers. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on: </strong>Europeans like to travel to other European countries during the summer, and countries opened up their borders to capture as much tourism revenue as possible. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But when you vacation in Mykonos, you risk getting a regrettable bicep tattoo and bringing COVID-19 back to your community. Germany’s government said that almost <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/europe-travel-coronavirus/2020/08/20/a426b6e4-e23e-11ea-82d8-5e55d47e90ca_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">40% of new infections</a> were the result of vacationers returning home. Italy pegs it at 30%. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What now? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Travel windows are <a href="https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/europe-travel-windows-closing/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tightening</a> across the continent to slow down the flow of people and the virus.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But many European leaders <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-20/merkel-says-aiming-to-avoid-new-national-lockdowns-in-europe?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agree</a>: We’re not going back to the lockdown days of balcony singalongs. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“We cannot shut down the country, because the collateral damage of confinement is considerable,” French President Emmanuel Macron told a magazine this week.</span></li>
</ul>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Politically, we want to avoid closing borders again at any cost,” said German Chancellor Angela Merkel Thursday.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The new strategy is to identify local clusters of infections and stamp them out before they can spread across the country. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the European economy is still expected to boom this quarter following historic shrinkage in the spring (UK retail sales are <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-53859148?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">already above</a> pre-pandemic levels). But the extent of the rebound will depend on reversing the worrying trend in case numbers.  </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/21/amazon-announces-surprising-retirement-possible-bezos-successor-jeff-wilke?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
And Then There Was One
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Jeff Wilke" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTg1L2plZmZfd2lsa2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>MARK RALSTON/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When it comes to executives named Jeff, Amazon's got a deeper bench than the U.S. men's basketball team. But it'll need to reload: Jeff Wilke, the head of Amazon’s consumer division, submitted his 5-month notice yesterday, saying <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/21/21395776/amazon-executive-wilke-retire-logistics-consumer-division?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">he plans to retire</a> in Q1 2021.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why it’s a big deal</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wilke, a 21-year Amazonian who oversees the company’s e-commerce and physical retail business, had long been rumored as a possible successor to CEO Jeff Bezos. He’s a member of Amazon’s fabled “S-team,” a group of Bezos’s top lieutenants from every division of the company. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A spot on the S-team is not like a summer job at the ice cream shop—</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/21/amazons-consumer-boss-jeff-wilke-to-step-down-in-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">turnover is extremely rare</a></span><span>, so any departure will raise some eyebrows.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But put those eyebrows right back down: </strong>Wilke said in a company memo that he’s leaving “to explore personal interests that have taken a back seat for over two decades.” Bezos, meanwhile, had nothing but good things to say about his Jeff-in-crime, adding that Wilke “is simply one of those people without whom Amazon would be completely unrecognizable.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>three execs were named to the S-team yesterday, including the council's first Black woman, VP of Global Customer Fulfillment Alicia Boler Davis.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/21/movie-theaters-across-country-start-reopen?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Movie Theaters This Weekend
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Show me the money clip" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=358 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/9HQRIttS5C4Za/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Show me the money clip" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/9HQRIttS5C4Za/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After a five-month intermission, movie theater chains AMC, Cinemark, Regal, and Marcus Theatres will all be <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/21/movie-theaters-reopen-this-weekend-but-attendance-is-in-question.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">showing movies</a> in the U.S. this weekend.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s not exactly a red carpet event: As the country still struggles to control the pandemic, only about 1,400 of roughly 6,000 North American venues are currently open, per Comscore.  </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Is it safe?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Health experts are concerned that an air-conditioned, enclosed space packed with lots of people slurping Cokes is a recipe for spreading the virus, but AMC is confident its newly installed <a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/lifestyle/amc-reopen-movie-theaters-sold-out-adam-aron?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">safety precautions</a> will do the trick. With the addition of plexiglass barriers, high tech air filters, and air purifiers, "You could eat off the floor of our theaters, they've never been this clean," CEO Adam Aron told Fox Business.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hold your applause:</strong> Theaters will mostly be showing <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/20/media/amc-theatres-reopen-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">older movies</a> like <em>Black Panther </em>and <em>Inception </em>for the first weeks of reopening. But if moviegoers show a sustained appetite for over-buttered popcorn—and chains show it’s safe—we could be whispering “Wait...what is happening?” to Christopher Nolan’s <em>Tenet</em> over Labor Day Weekend.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/21/majority-students-say-university-implementing-hybrid-model-fall?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What's <em>Actually </em>Going on at Colleges?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A Harvard University building" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNzkvaGFydmFyZF91bml2ZXJzaXR5LnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Harvard University</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Wednesday, we asked our college student readers about their plans for this fall. 1,200+ responses later...here are the results:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">64%</strong></span><span> of students said their schools are implementing a hybrid model of both in-person and online learning. </span><span><strong style="color:#000">32%</strong></span><span> are going fully remote, and only </span><span><strong style="color:#000">4%</strong></span><span> are fully in-person.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">95%</strong></span><span> of students surveyed are enrolling in school this fall, while </span><span><strong style="color:#000">5%</strong></span><span> are deferring/taking a gap year. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Of those enrolling, </span><span><strong style="color:#000">63%</strong></span><span> are returning to campus while </span><span><strong style="color:#000">37%</strong></span><span> will be catching Zoom U from an alternate location. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A global pandemic is a great excuse to skip class, and those who are deferring are keeping themselves busy. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Some students are working in their hometowns, continuing their summer internships, self-studying, and spearheading their own business ventures. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Others are road tripping, quaranteaming with friends in Airbnbs, and, surprisingly, a few students are studying abroad. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here...</strong>shoutout to our amazing ambassadors who are spreading the good word of the Brew on campuses (and couches) nationwide. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/21/psg-munich-set-battle-champions-league-final?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's Goliath vs. Goliath in the Champions League Final
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="PSG celebrates a goal" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTg3L3BzZ19jZWxlYnJhdGVzX2FfZ29hbC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Clive Rose/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The biggest match on the global soccer calendar will take place tomorrow, when Germany’s Bayern Munich faces Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) in the Champions League final in Lisbon, Portugal. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Both clubs are financial powerhouses with a common backer: the Gulf state of Qatar. In 2011, PSG was famously taken over by an arm of the country’s sovereign wealth fund, then plugged with <a href="https://www.si.com/soccer/2020/08/20/bayern-munich-psg-champions-league-final-preview-superclubs-qatar?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">untold riches</a> to make it to this very stage. Bayern Munich is certainly more “old money,” but it too is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/its-psg-bayern-munich-in-the-champions-league-final-but-the-memory-of-barcelona-lingers-11598004001?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sponsored</a> by Qatar Airways—no wonder the airline is trying to brand the match the “Qlassico.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So who is going to win? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bayern Munich is a well-oiled machine, but German Chancellor Angela Merkel’s reluctance to reimpose lockdowns could leave the midfield open for PSG’s Neymar and Kylian Mbappe to roam free. PSG will take home the title, 3–1.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In our Headline Contest yesterday, we asked you to come up with a funny zinger that could top a story on Taco Bell’s new high-tech, drive-thru focused <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/20/can-think-funny-headline-taco-bells-new-restaurant-concept?email={{profile.email}}&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">restaurant concept</a>. Here are our favorites from more than 1,000 responses:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Drive Thrus Just Got More Confusing for Stoners"—Matt in Melrose, MA</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Taco Bell Plays Hard Shell With Pandemic"—A.J. in Germany</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Go Mobile: Faster Thru Us, Faster Thru You"—Stephen in Hollywood, FL</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Taco Bell—An Amazon Company"—Henry in Saint Louis</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Covid Put On Baja Blast"—Sam in Minneapolis</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Nacho Average Taco Bell"—many people in many places</span></li>
</ul>
</td>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/21/europe-battles-higher-caseloads-economic-warning-signs?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nEurope’s Recovering on the Wrong Side of the Road\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Men wearing stirped shirts taking tourists on a Euopean boat tour\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTg2L2V1cm9wZWFuX2JvYXRfdG91ci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eANDREA PATTARO/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSometimes, all it takes is one number to tell a much larger story. That number: 51.6.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, IHS Markit's purchasing managers’ index for the 19-country eurozone \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/8f31e8d12dcd08fd1a43ca140ef3a482?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped\u003c/a\u003e to 51.6 in August from 54.9 in July. It’s a closely watched indicator of business activity and its slippage reveals that, after a hot start, Europe’s economic recovery has hit the breaks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSummertime sadness\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn these pandemic times, economic slippage often correlates with rising caseloads. And this week, European heavyweights Germany, Italy, and France all reported their highest new coronavirus case numbers since the spring. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSpain, in particular, is experiencing a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/4e3e3e31-87ed-4631-af62-c649efb854ed?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworse outbreak\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e than its peers. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on: \u003c/strong\u003eEuropeans like to travel to other European countries during the summer, and countries opened up their borders to capture as much tourism revenue as possible. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut when you vacation in Mykonos, you risk getting a regrettable bicep tattoo and bringing COVID-19 back to your community. Germany’s government said that almost \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/europe-travel-coronavirus/2020/08/20/a426b6e4-e23e-11ea-82d8-5e55d47e90ca_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e40% of new infections\u003c/a\u003e were the result of vacationers returning home. Italy pegs it at 30%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat now? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTravel windows are \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/europe-travel-windows-closing/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etightening\u003c/a\u003e across the continent to slow down the flow of people and the virus.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut many European leaders \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-20/merkel-says-aiming-to-avoid-new-national-lockdowns-in-europe?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eagree\u003c/a\u003e: We’re not going back to the lockdown days of balcony singalongs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“We cannot shut down the country, because the collateral damage of confinement is considerable,” French President Emmanuel Macron told a magazine this week.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Politically, we want to avoid closing borders again at any cost,” said German Chancellor Angela Merkel Thursday.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe new strategy is to identify local clusters of infections and stamp them out before they can spread across the country. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe European economy is still expected to boom this quarter following historic shrinkage in the spring (UK retail sales are \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-53859148?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealready above\u003c/a\u003e pre-pandemic levels). But the extent of the rebound will depend on reversing the worrying trend in case numbers.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen it comes to executives named Jeff, Amazon's got a deeper bench than the U.S. men's basketball team. But it'll need to reload: Jeff Wilke, the head of Amazon’s consumer division, submitted his 5-month notice yesterday, saying \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/21/21395776/amazon-executive-wilke-retire-logistics-consumer-division?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehe plans to retire\u003c/a\u003e in Q1 2021.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy it’s a big deal\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWilke, a 21-year Amazonian who oversees the company’s e-commerce and physical retail business, had long been rumored as a possible successor to CEO Jeff Bezos. He’s a member of Amazon’s fabled “S-team,” a group of Bezos’s top lieutenants from every division of the company. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA spot on the S-team is not like a summer job at the ice cream shop—\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/21/amazons-consumer-boss-jeff-wilke-to-step-down-in-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eturnover is extremely rare\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, so any departure will raise some eyebrows.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut put those eyebrows right back down: \u003c/strong\u003eWilke said in a company memo that he’s leaving “to explore personal interests that have taken a back seat for over two decades.” Bezos, meanwhile, had nothing but good things to say about his Jeff-in-crime, adding that Wilke “is simply one of those people without whom Amazon would be completely unrecognizable.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethree execs were named to the S-team yesterday, including the council's first Black woman, VP of Global Customer Fulfillment Alicia Boler Davis.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter a five-month intermission, movie theater chains AMC, Cinemark, Regal, and Marcus Theatres will all be \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/21/movie-theaters-reopen-this-weekend-but-attendance-is-in-question.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshowing movies\u003c/a\u003e in the U.S. this weekend.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s not exactly a red carpet event: As the country still struggles to control the pandemic, only about 1,400 of roughly 6,000 North American venues are currently open, per Comscore.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIs it safe?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHealth experts are concerned that an air-conditioned, enclosed space packed with lots of people slurping Cokes is a recipe for spreading the virus, but AMC is confident its newly installed \u003ca href=\"https://www.foxbusiness.com/lifestyle/amc-reopen-movie-theaters-sold-out-adam-aron?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esafety precautions\u003c/a\u003e will do the trick. With the addition of plexiglass barriers, high tech air filters, and air purifiers, \"You could eat off the floor of our theaters, they've never been this clean,\" CEO Adam Aron told Fox Business.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHold your applause:\u003c/strong\u003e Theaters will mostly be showing \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/20/media/amc-theatres-reopen-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eolder movies\u003c/a\u003e like \u003cem\u003eBlack Panther \u003c/em\u003eand \u003cem\u003eInception \u003c/em\u003efor the first weeks of reopening. But if moviegoers show a sustained appetite for over-buttered popcorn—and chains show it’s safe—we could be whispering “Wait...what is happening?” to Christopher Nolan’s \u003cem\u003eTenet\u003c/em\u003e over Labor Day Weekend.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
